c:complexType.name: WaterfallChart
c:complexType.c:documentation: The options documentation class of the Waterfall chart.

c:property.name: water
c:property.c:documentation: The waterfall plot is the main plot of the waterfall chart, which means that its properties may be used without the "water" property suffix.

c:complexType.name: WaterfallPlot
c:complexType.c:documentation: The options documentation class of the Bar plot.

c:property.name: stacked
c:property.c:documentation: This plot type is necessarily stacked.

c:property.name: totalLineLabel
c:property.c:documentation: The description of the legend item of the water line.

c:property.name: allCategoryLabel
c:property.c:documentation: The description of the fictitious root category that aggregates all other categories.

c:property.name: totalValuesVisible
c:property.c:documentation:
Indicates if value labels are shown above or below the water line showing the accumulated value.
The default value is the value of the property .

c:property.name: areasVisible
c:property.c:documentation:
Indicates if shaded areas are shown in the plot.
Specifically, indicates if areas are shown surrounding the bars of each category group.

c:property.name: extensionPoints
c:property.c:documentation: The extension points object contains style definitions for the marks of the plot.

c:complexType.name: WaterfallPlotExtensionPoints
c:complexType.c:documentation:
The extension points of the waterfall plot type.
Plot extension points can be specified:
at the plot level, in the extensionPoints property, without need to prefix the extension point with the plot id or name.
at the plot options level, directly, without need to prefix the extension point with the plot id or name.
if it is an internal plot (main, plot2 or trend), at the chart options level, directly.
To use an extension point you must find its full name, by joining:
plot property name (ex: water)
extension property (ex: line)
the "_" character
extension sub-property (ex: strokeStyle)
and obtaining, for the examples, the camel-cased name: waterLine_strokeStyle (see ).
The extension points of the main plot of a chart may be used without the plot property name prefix. In the example, when the water plot is the main plot, the extension point can be written as line_strokeStyle.

c:property.name: group
c:property.c:documentation:
The extension point of the group panel mark.
The group panel visually contains all bars that belong to the same group.

c:property.name: line
c:property.c:documentation: The extension point of the top water line mark.

c:property.name: lineLabel
c:property.c:documentation: The extension point of the category total label mark, that is placed near the water line.
